job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-26T21:29:15.000Z", "description": "

Role: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) 

Duration: 6+ months with possible extension(s)

Location: Remote

 

Note: Immediate fill 

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Build highly scalable, high-performant infrastructure on Amazon Web Service (AWS)
  • Work with applications to use automated CI/CD pipelines and build secure cloud environments, identities, and services. Deploy applications into these cloud environments through automated processes and programmatic services.
  • Maintain application reliability and uptime SLAs throughout the application lifecycle using programmatic self-healing and software automation
  • Develop software to monitor and improve end-to-end platform performance, identify runtime deficiencies, find potential failures, and fix production issues
  • Build deep, full-stack knowledge of the complexity of our platforms and applications. Work to simplify and automate deployment processes, run-time operations, and provide non-disruptive releases.
  • Improve the durability, simplicity, performance, and maintainability of our integrated landscape
  • Apply your expertise to our most complex digital projects. Meet with department and business unit clients to understand their application needs.
  • Be responsible for driving feedback and new design ideas back into the DevSecOps platform team. Help identify and remediate architectural problems, scalability, availability and performance issues.
  • Be an integral member of the core DevSecOps/DataOps development team and help develop, test, deploy, and operated the service 24x7x365 globally. Must be open to participating in an on-call rotation, as needed.
  • Hands-on experience with configuration frameworks for deployment such as AWS CloudFormation Templates, Ansible, Terraform, Chef, Puppet, or Salt
  • Proven proficiency with scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, and JavaScript, and build tools such as Maven, Ant, Gradle or Ivy
  • Solid knowledge of various Linux environments. Distro's include Ubuntu, Centos, Debian, RedHat, and Amazon Linux, as well as familiarity with Windows OS\u2019s.
  • Understand security and encryption technologies. Knowledge of authentication protocols including OpenID, OIDC, OAuth, SAML, and LDAP.
  • Knowledge of Docker containerization and Kubernetes/EKS cluster management for container orchestration
  • Experience with automated monitoring frameworks such as InfluxDB, Grafana, Telegraf, Fluentd, Prometheus, etc.
  • Application and system level debug and triage experience.
  • Experience managing distributed runtime applications using programmatic interfaces
  • Experience running full stack application deployments and infrastructure cloud services (Storage, VMs, Network, etc.)
  • Practical experience migrating large-scale infrastructure onto public cloud technology platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP is a plus.
  • Familiarity deploying, monitoring, and running serverless computing and microservices a plus
